item.title: Ticket #692 (Allow for other than "index.php") created
item.dc:creator: TechGnome
item.description:
I've been noticing that several people have asked how to get WP to use a file other than index.php. Would it be too difficult to have an additional option in WP where the user could indicate the file name of the blog? By default it would be set to "index.php" but if some one wanted, say "blog.php" or "news.php" then they could use that. Then, when WP is generating it's links, it would use that filename in the links. Changes to the permalinks (& htaccess) would also need to be done to point to the right file.

Possible or no? Reasonable or not?

item.dc:creator: TechGnome
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #691 (Cannot Close Comments/Pingbacks on new Pages) created
item.dc:creator: TechGnome
item.description:
When creating a new page, clearing the "Allow Comments" and "Allow Pings" does not seem to stay. 1) From the Admin scree, click "Write" then "Write Page" 2) Enter a title, clear the comments & pings check boxes, and enter some test text. 3) Click "Create New Page" 4) After page is saved, click the "Manage Pages" link 5) From there, click the "Edit" link for the newly created page. 6) Note that the "Allow Comments" and "Allow Pings" settings are set to on, and not off as expected.

7) Clear the check boxes and click "Edit Page" 8) Click on the Edit link again for the page 9) Now the check boxes are cleared.

item.title: Ticket #688 (Asymmetry in Character Escaping) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #688 (Asymmetry in Character Escaping) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
There is a bug in at least the 'links' configuration section. When one creates a link with a single quote (') character everything works fine. However, when bringing this link back up with the 'Edit' feature the link's quote characters are escaped with a backslash (\). If one then saves any changes to the link, the Word Press code then escapes out both the backslash and the single quote again. Thus, we end up with this in the links page:

Intended: Scott's Home Displayed: Scott\'s Home Internal: Scott
\'s Home

In summary, the code that reproduces the link in the edit box should probably not display the escape characters that are internally being used to store special characters. This probably applies to a lot more than just a single quote!

item.dc:creator: steph-tara
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #685 (wp_list_cats() leaves out categories) created
item.dc:creator: steph-tara
item.description:
wp_list_cats() seems to make the assumption that the parent category has an ID which is lower than its children's. This is not always true. The algorithm used to retrieve cats causes some of them to be left out (in my case, I ended up with 20 cats out of my 70 or so).

passing arguments in the function, however, solves the problem: wp_list_cats('hide_empty=0&sort_column=name') shows all my cats.

It would be nice to have the "default" behaviour of the function not risk leaving out categories from people's listings.
